COP 27 Side Event at the Moroccan Pavilion
Low Carbon Transition resilient to Climate Change Friday November 11" from 2:30 pm to 4:00 pm Hybrid format: https://bit.ly/3EkGx7E
Background
As part of The Paris Agreement commitments and in the urge of concrete climate action, the Kingdom of Morocco is accelerating its mitigation policies by raising its Nationally Determined Contribution (NDC) ambition to 45.5% by 2030, and the development of a Low Emission Development Strategy (LEDS) aiming to reach net zero by 2050
In order to support this ambition, The Mohammed VI Foundation for Environmental Protection under the effective Presidency of Her Royal Highness Princess Lalla Hasnaa, together with its partners gathered within the framework of The Convention for decarbonization of the Moroccan economy
Therefore, in July 2021, the Ministry of Industry and Trade, the Ministry of Energy Transition and Sustainable Development, the National Agency for Energy Efficiency (AMEE), the Moroccan Institute for Standardization (IMANOR), the General Confederation of Moroccan Enterprises (CGEM), as well as the Mohammed VI Foundation for Environmental Protection, came together and decided to implement joint actions in favor of decarbonization and climate resilience
At a time when the European Union is setting up the CBAM (Carbon Border Adjustment Mechanism), it is primarily a question of supporting Moroccan companies to better understand their carbon footprint, by providing them with the tools and support to measure their emissions reduce them and finally offset irreducible emissions

The signing on October 18", 2022 of the Green Deal between Morocco and the European Union (EU) will accelerate this transition towards a green and inclusive economy, listed as a priority for bilateral relations between Morocco and the EU.
The objective of this Side Event is to highlight international and national initiatives to accelerate the low carbon transition that will allow Morocco to meet its ambitious objectives, and move forward on concrete climate actions.
